reference-wr.title: Alarm Messages
reference-wr.shortdesc: The system inventory and maintenance service reports system changes with different degrees of severity. Use the reported alarms to monitor the overall health of the system.

section.p: In the following tables, the severity of the alarms is represented by one or more letters, as follows:
A slash-separated list of letters is used when the alarm can be triggered with one of several severity levels.

entry.p: Platform CPU threshold exceeded; threshold x%, actual y% .
Monitor and if condition persists, contact next level of support.
VSwitch CPU threshold exceeded; threshold x%, actual y% .
Monitor and if condition persists, contact next level of support.
Memory threshold exceeded; threshold x%, actual y% .
Monitor and if condition persists, contact next level of support; may require additional memory on Host.
File System threshold exceeded; threshold x%, actual y%
Monitor and if condition persists, contact next level of support.
File System threshold exceeded; threshold x%, actual y%
Monitor and if condition persists, consider adding additional physical volumes to the volume group.
No access to remote VM volumes.
Check Management and Infrastructure Networks and Controller or Storage Nodes.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
NTP configuration does not contain any valid or reachable NTP servers.
Monitor and if condition persists, contact next level of support.
NTP address <IP address> is not a valid or a reachable NTP server.
VSwitch Memory Usage, processor <processor> threshold exceeded; threshold x%, actual y%
Monitor and if condition persists, contact next level of support
Cinder LVM Thinpool Usage threshold exceeded; threshold x%, actual y% .
Monitor and if condition persists, contact next level of support.
Nova LVM Thinpool Usage threshold exceeded; threshold x%, actual y% .
Monitor and if condition persists, contact next level of support.
Controller cannot establish connection with remote logging server.
Ensure Remote Log Server IP is reachable from Controller through OAM interface; otherwise contact next level of support
<hostname> was administratively locked to take it out-of-service.
Administratively unlock Host to bring it back in-service.
Host is being auto recovered by Reboot.
If auto-recovery is consistently unable to recover host to the unlocked-enabled state contact next level of support or lock and replace failing host.
<hostname> is experiencing an intermittent 'Management Network' communication failures that have exceeded its lower alarming threshold.

Check 'Management Network' connectivity and support for multicast messaging. If problem consistently occurs after that and Host is reset, then contact next level of support or lock and replace failing host.
<hostname> is experiencing a persistent Critical 'Management Network' communication failure.
<hostname> 'Process Monitor' (pmond) process is not running or functioning properly. The system is trying to recover this process.
Critical: <hostname> Critical '<processname>' process has failed and could not be auto-recovered gracefully. Auto-recovery progression by host reboot is required and in progress.
Major: <hostname> is degraded due to the failure of its '<processname>' process. Auto recovery of this Major process is in progress.
<hostname> '<processname>' process has failed. Auto recovery of this Minor process is in progress.
<hostname> '<processname>' process has failed. Manual recovery is required.
If this alarm does not automatically clear after some time and continues to be asserted after Host is locked and unlocked then contact next level of support for root cause analysis and recovery.
If problem consistently occurs after Host is locked and unlocked then contact next level of support for root cause analysys and recovery.
Host is degraded due to a 'Critical' out-of-tolerance reading from the '<sensorname>' sensor
Host is degraded due to a 'Major' out-of-tolerance reading from the '<sensorname>' sensor
Host is reporting a 'Minor' out-of-tolerance reading from the '<sensorname>' sensor
If problem consistently occurs after Host is power cycled and or reset, contact next level of support or lock and replace failing host.
<hostname> is experiencing an intermittent 'Infrastructure Network' communication failures that have exceeded its lower alarming threshold.

Check 'Infrastructure Network' connectivity and support for multicast messaging. If problem consistently occurs after that and Host is reset, then contact next level of support or lock and replace failing host.
<hostname> is experiencing a persistent Critical 'Infrastructure Network' communication failure.
<hostname> access to board management module has failed.
Check Host's board management configuration and connectivity.
<hostname> experienced a configuration failure during initialization. Host is being re-configured by Reboot.
If auto-recovery is consistently unable to recover host to the unlocked-enabled state contact next level of support or lock and replace failing host.
<hostname> controller function has in-service failure while compute services remain healthy.

Lock and then Unlock host to recover. Avoid using 'Force Lock' action as that will impact compute services running on this host. If lock action fails then contact next level of support to investigate and recover.
<hostname> compute service of the only available controller is not poperational. Auto-recovery is disabled. Degrading host instead.
Enable second controller and Switch Activity (Swact) over to it as soon as possible. Then Lock and Unlock host to recover its local compute service.
The Hardware Monitor was unable to load, configure and monitor one or more hardware sensors.

Check Board Management Controller provisioning. Try reprovisioning the BMC. If problem persists try power cycling the host and then the entire server including the BMC power. If problem persists then contact next level of support.
Unable to read one or more sensor groups from this host's board management controller
Check board management connectivity and try rebooting the board management controller. If problem persists contact next level of support or lock and replace failing host.
Administratively lock and unlock <hostname> to update config.
<hostname> Ceph cache tiering configuration is out-of-date.
<hostname> Configuration action is required to provision compute function.
<hostname> action required. Configure data intefaces and then perform system compute-config-complete.
Wait for host services recovery to complete; if problem persists contact next level of support
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
If condition persists, attempt to clear issue by administratively locking and unlocking the Host.
No enabled compute host with connectivity to provider network.
Enable compute hosts with required provider network connectivity.
Communication failure detected over provider network x% for ranges y% on host z%.
Communication failure detected over provider network x% on host z%.
Check neighbour switch port VLAN assignments.
ML2 Driver Agent reachable but non-responsive
ML2 Driver Agent is unable to sync Neutron database
Monitor and if condition persists, contact next level of support.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
No active Openflow controller connections found for this network.
One or more Openflow controller connections in disconnected state for this network.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
Service group failure; <list of affected services>.
Service group degraded; <list of affected services>.
Service group Warning; <list of affected services>.
Service group loss of redundancy; expected <num> standby member<s> but only <num> standby member<s> available.
Service group loss of redundancy; expected <num> standby member<s> but only <num> standby member<s> available.
Service group loss of redundancy; expected <num> active member<s> but no active members available.
Service group loss of redundancy; expected <num> active member<s> but only <num> active member<s> available.
Bring a controller node back in to service, otherwise contact next level of support.
License key has expired or is invalid; a valid license key is required for operation.
Evaluation license key will expire on <date>; there are <num_days> days remaining in this evaluation.
Evaluation license key will expire on <date>; there is only 1 day remaining in this evaluation.
Contact next level of support to obtain a new license key.
Communication failure detected with peer over port <linux-ifname>.
Communication failure detected with peer over port <linux-ifname> within the last 30 seconds.
Check cabling and far-end port configuration and status on adjacent equipment.
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> has failed on host <host_name>
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> has failed to schedule
The system will attempt recovery; no repair action required
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> is paused on host <host_name>
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> is suspended on host <host_name>
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> is stopped on host <host_name>
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> is rebooting on host <host_name>
Wait for reboot to complete; if problem persists contact next level of support
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> is rebuilding on host <host_name>
Wait for rebuild to complete; if problem persists contact next level of support
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> is evacuating from host <host_name>
Wait for evacuate to complete; if problem persists contact next level of support
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> is live migrating from host <host_name>
Wait for live migration to complete; if problem persists contact next level of support
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> is cold migrating from host <host_name>
Wait for cold migration to complete; if problem persists contact next level of support
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> has been cold-migrated to host <host_name> waiting for confirmation
Confirm or revert cold-migrate of instance
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> is reverting cold migrate to host <host_name>
Wait for cold migration revert to complete; if problem persists contact next level of support"
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> is resizing on host <host_name>
Wait for resize to complete; if problem persists contact next level of support
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> has been resized on host <host_name> waiting for confirmation
Confirm or revert resize of instance
Instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> is reverting resize on host <host_name>
Wait for resize revert to complete; if problem persists contact next level of support"
Guest Heartbeat not established for instance <instance_name> owned by <tenant_name> on host <host_name>
Verify that the instance is running the Guest-Client daemon, or disabsle Guest Heartbeat for the instance if no longer needed, otherwise contact next level of support.
Wait for the system to exit out of this mode.
Server group <server_group_name> <policy> policy was not satisfied
Migrate instances in an attempt to satisfy the policy; if problem persists contact next level of support.
If problem persists, contact next level of support.
Image storage media is full: There is not enough disk space on the image storage media.
Instance <instance name> snapshot failed: There is not enough disk space on the image storage media.
Supplied <attrs> (<supplied>) and <attrs> generated from uploaded image (<actual>) did not match. Setting image status to 'killed'.
Error in store configuration. Adding images to store is disabled.
Insufficient permissions on image storage media: <exception>
Denying attempt to upload image larger than <size> bytes.
Denying attempt to upload image because it exceeds the quota: <exception>
Received HTTP error while uploading image <image_id>
Client disconnected before sending all data to backend
If problem persists, contact next level of support.
US77470 addedStorage Alarm Condition: total ceph cluster size greater than sum of individual pool quotas
Update ceph storage pool quotas to use all available cluster space.
US77470 addedPotential data loss. No available OSDs in storage replication group.
Ensure storage hosts from replication group are unlocked and available. Check if OSDs of each storage host are up and running. If problem persists contact next level of support.
US77470 addedLoss of replication in peergroup.
Ensure storage hosts from replication group are unlocked and available. Check if OSDs of each storage host are up and running. If problem persists contact next level of support.
Cinder I/O Congestion is above normal range and is building
Reduce the I/O load on the Cinder LVM backend. Use Cinder QoS mechanisms on high usage volumes.
Cinder I/O Congestion is high and impacting guest performance
Reduce the I/O load on the Cinder LVM backend. Cinder actions may fail until congestion is reduced. Use Cinder QoS mechanisms on high usage volumes.
Reinstall host to update applied load.
ait for software update auto-apply to complete; if problem persists contact next level of support.
Wait for software update auto-apply abort to complete; if problem persists contact next level of support.
Attempt to apply software updates manually; if problem persists contact next level of support.
